name: First Steps (Kentucky Early Intervention System)
description: Statewide early intervention system that provides services to children with developmental disabilities from birth to age 3 and their families. Offers comprehensive services through community agencies and developmental service specialists to help children reach their developmental milestones.
source: Verified from official Kentucky government website
hours_of_operation: Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM Eastern
eligibility_requirements: Children from birth to age 3 with developmental delays, established risk conditions, or informed clinical opinion. Available in all Kentucky counties.
populations_served: Children birth to age 3 with developmental disabilities and their families
cost_information: Most families receive services at no cost. Some families with highest incomes may be asked to share costs (up to $400/month based on sliding fee scale).
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2024-01-15. CITATIONS: Contact information verified from official Kentucky government website https://chfs.ky.gov/agencies/dph/dmch/ecdb/Pages/keis.aspx. Phone numbers (502) 564-3756 and toll-free (877) 417-8377 confirmed working. Address 275 E. Main St., HS2-EE, Frankfort, KY 40621 verified on official website. Email DPHKEIS@ky.gov verified from official website. Website https://chfs.ky.gov/agencies/dph/dmch/ecdb/Pages/keis.aspx verified current and accessible. Hours confirmed as Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM Eastern from official website. Services verified as statewide early intervention for children birth to age 3. All information cross-referenced with multiple sources including official government documentation for consistency.
